meanings.definition: To convert (checks, money, etc.) into cash.
meanings.sent1: She encashes her paycheck every Friday at the bank.
meanings.sent2: The winner of the contest encashes their prize immediately.
meanings.sent3: The magician encashes the audience's amazement into a grand finale.
meanings.sent4: His hard work encashes into success beyond his dreams.
meanings.sent5: The sun encashes its warmth into a golden sunset.

meanings.sent1: He encashes his chips at the casino after a lucky streak.
meanings.sent2: The company decides to encash on the latest trend in the market.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel encashes on the abundance of acorns by storing them for winter.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to invest early encashes in long-term financial security.
meanings.sent5: The athlete encashes on years of training with a record-breaking performance.
